intro: Appendicula pilosa var. sumatrana, commonly known as the Sumatran appendicula, is a species of flowering plant native to the island of Sumatra. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, often arranged in umbels. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in montane forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
